intro: Klasea pusilla, commonly known as the dwarf klasea, is a small, herbaceous plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. The plant features tiny, narrow leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid conditions. Its flowers are small and clustered, usually in shades of white or pale yellow, and bloom during the warmer months. Klasea pusilla is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its compact size and unique appearance.
